oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Characterisation of erwinias causing blackleg and soft rot in Finland
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Laurila, Jaana
Joutsjoki, Tiina
Lehtinen, Ari
Ahola, Virpi
Hannukkala, Asko
Pirhonen, Minna
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Potato stems showing blackleg or wilting were collected during 2003-2004 and the erwinias were isolated based on cavity forming on pectate-containing media followed by anaerobic growth test. Bacteri were also isolated from rotting tubers and from water samples collected from rivers in southern and western Finland.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Laurila, Jaana; Joutsjoki, Tiina; Lehtinen, Ari; Ahola, Virpi; Hannukkala, Asko and Pirhonen, Minna (2006) Characterisation of erwinias causing blackleg and soft rot in Finland. In: NJF report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 2 (1), NJF Report, p. 25.
